comments:
I have copied two existent projcets into my runtime-workspace, then I try to 
import the project into the workspace by selecting the runtime-workspace 
directory. Then, I can see from the progress bar that C/C++ Indexer is 
starting, then stuck (always 0%)

When I try to close the import window, the following promption dialog pops up:
  "Wizard can not be closed due to an active operation. You must cancel the 
operation before you can close the wizard."

Seems there is something wrong with the indexer. Here is output from the 
console:

org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.AssertionFailedException: Assertion failed: 
Malformed tree.
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.dtree.DeltaDataTree.getChildNodes
(DeltaDataTree.java:522)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.dtree.DeltaDataTree.getChildren
(DeltaDataTree.java:534)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTree.getChildIDs
(ElementTree.java:331)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.watson.ElementTree.getChildren
(ElementTree.java:347)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Container.getChildren
(Container.java:93)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkspaceRoot.getProjects
(WorkspaceRoot.java:152)
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.pathForLocation
(FileSystemResourceManager.java:475)
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.fileForLocation
(FileSystemResourceManager.java:194)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.WorkspaceRoot.getFileForLocation
(WorkspaceRoot.java:87)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.index.domsourceindexer.IndexEncoderUtil.calculate
IndexFlags(IndexEncoderUtil.java:38)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.index.domsourceindexer.CGenerateIndexVisitor.proc
essName(CGenerateIndexVisitor.java:135)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.index.domsourceindexer.CGenerateIndexVisitor.visi
t(CGenerateIndexVisitor.java:80)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.parser.c.CASTName.accept
(CASTName.java:86)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.parser.c.CASTDeclarator.accept
(CASTDeclarator.java:124)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.parser.c.CASTSimpleDeclaration.accept
(CASTSimpleDeclaration.java:74)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.parser.c.CASTTranslationUnit.accept
(CASTTranslationUnit.java:481)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.index.domsourceindexer.DOMSourceIndexerRunner.ind
exFile(DOMSourceIndexerRunner.java:133)
	at 
org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.index.domsourceindexer.AbstractIndexerRunner.inde
x(AbstractIndexerRunner.java:76)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.index.cindexstorage.Index.add
(Index.java:110)

org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.index.domsourceindexer.DOMAddCompilationUnitToInd
ex.indexDocument(DOMAddCompilationUnitToIndex.java:29)

The DOM indexer doesn't exist anymore so I'm marking this WONTFIX.  If this shows up still with the CDT 4.0 indexers please reopen this bug.
